result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stuart C Vroome

records.addlTxt:
(Cases 22CF791, 22CF832, 22CF898, 22CF1014 are called at 1:49 PM) Defendant Stuart C. Vroome in court, in custody with Attorney Brian A. Braziel.  Attorney Andrew J. Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF791, 22CF832, 22CF898, 22CF1014. 
Arraignment to be scheduled with Branch 3 Judicial Assistant.

1:31 PM Cases called: 22CF791, 22CF832, 22CF898 & 22CF1014. Defendant Stuart C Vroome in court, in custody.  Attorney Brian A Braziel appeared via video appearance for Stuart C Vroome.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
 
Defendant is unclear as to one issue involving waiving the preliminary hearings. Court finds good cause to extend the time limits for the preliminary hearing in all files. 
Preliminary Hearing: 10/11/22 at 1:30pm in all files.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Dated 09/27/2022, Letter from Attorney Brian Braziel requesting to appear by Zoom for 09/27/2022 Preliminary Hearing

1:31 PM cases 22CF791, 22CF832, 22CF898, 22CF1014 called. Defendant Stuart C Vroome in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant advises they are in the process of obtaining an attorney from  Weld Riley- Court notes there is no notice of retainer on file from Weld Riley. Defendant makes a statement. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Matters are re scheduled for preliminary hearings.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

(11:50 AM case called.) Defendant Stuart C Vroome appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Law Intern David Carlson, supervised by Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Stuart C Vroome. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint.
Defendant is not eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $15,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defense requests $1,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $5,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Conditions:
Not to possess any combustibles of any sort. Not to start any fires.
